Investigations are underway to determine the cause, with possibilities including illegal firecrackers or a battery. Authorities are reviewing CCTV footage and questioning shopkeepers.

She also said that the global economy is faring better than feared, but warned resilience may not last amid Trump-era tariffs, rising debt, and global uncertainty. Despite US-imposed tariffs, India recorded 7.8% GDP growth in Q1 FY 2025–26, driven by consumption and investment.

Manufacturers are now mandated to rigorously test all raw materials and finished products, ensuring compliance with drug-testing rules. The directive emphasizes robust vendor qualification and sourcing from approved suppliers to prevent future health risks to children.

title: Soybeans are new rare earths: Xi hits Trump where it hurts - US heartland
description: China's abrupt halt to US soybean purchases, a critical export, has sent prices plummeting and farmers into panic. This strategic move, mirroring past rare earth tactics, aims to pressure President Trump ahead of the APEC summit. Farmers face a double blow of rising costs and a vanishing market, with potential for significant economic fallout in rural America.

title: ‘Not an insult’: Nakamura defends king toss at Gukesh; calls it pure entertainment
description: Hikaru Nakamura defended tossing D Gukesh's king into the crowd at an exhibition event, stating it was part of the organizers' entertainment format. He clarified it was not an insult, emphasizing the difference between a serious tournament and a purely entertainment-focused match. Nakamura also playfully suggested Gukesh could dance on the chessboard if he wins the reverse match in India.

The woman has been booked under relevant sections of the BNS, but no arrests have been made.

Despite stepping down as ODI captain, his infectious energy and leadership presence remain a significant asset for the Indian team as they prepare for the upcoming series against Australia that will commence on October 19.

Chemistry Nobel explained: How winners created materials to save planet
description: So, say hello to the men who turned chemistry from Breaking Bad into Breaking Good. This year’s Nobel Prize in Chemistry is actually pretty easy to get — and no, it doesn’t involve blue crystals or an RV in the desert. The 2025 Nobel went to Richard Robson, Susumu Kitagawa, and Omar Yaghi for inventing something called metal–organic frameworks, or MOFs. If that sounds like chemistry jargon designed to make you feel stupid, relax. MOFs are basically sponges made of metal and carbon, but on a molecular level — invisible, perfect, and outrageously clever.

Despite the confusion, wicketkeeper-batter Sanju Samson revealed the team celebrated with an "imaginary trophy," maintaining a positive dressing room environment. The incident has led to an administrative standoff, with the trophy still missing.

title: Nvidia CEO Jensen Huang says no degree needed for six-figure jobs
description: Nvidia CEO Jensen Huang says skilled trades like electricians, plumbers, and carpenters can earn six-figure salaries without college degrees, driven by the rapid growth of data centers. As AI infrastructure expands, demand for hands-on expertise is soaring, offering lucrative, stable careers. Huang urges young professionals to value practical, science-based skills over traditional academic routes.

Cough syrup deaths: Furore over doctor's arrest; FAIMA writes to Centre
description: Medical associations are demanding the immediate release of a doctor arrested in connection with child deaths linked to contaminated cough syrup. They urge a thorough investigation to ensure justice for victims and protect medical professionals from wrongful blame. The group also proposed measures to the health ministry to prevent future incidents, including central oversight and nationwide drug testing.

Banerjee also highlighted ongoing relief and rehabilitation work in flood-affected North Bengal, promising further oversight.

Israel stated the 145 activists were in good health and would be deported, calling the attempt to breach the blockade futile.

The entire 33.5 km underground line will serve 13 lakh passengers daily.

Fans, frustrated by playoff exits, questioned his priorities, especially given his lucrative deal, highlighting dwindling patience until a Stanley Cup is delivered.

description: The 2025 Nobel Prize in Chemistry honours Susumu Kitagawa, Richard Robson, and Omar M Yaghi. They developed metal-organic frameworks, a new molecular architecture. These porous materials offer custom-made solutions for energy, storage, and catalysis. This breakthrough revolutionises material design with vast potential for new functions.

‘3 prizes in 2 years’: CEO Pichai celebrates Googlers winning Nobel Prize; says ‘Feeling lucky’
description: Google's Sundar Pichai celebrated Michel Devoret, John Martinis, and John Clarke's 2025 Nobel Prize in Physics. This marks Google's fifth Nobel laureate in two years, with Devoret leading hardware at Quantum AI and Martinis a former hardware team leader. Their foundational 1980s quantum mechanics research is credited with enabling future error-corrected quantum computers.

title: New proxy war? Pak's ISI forges LeT-ISKP alliance; what it means for India's security
description: Lashkar-e-Taiba and ISKP have reportedly formed a covert alliance in Balochistan. This partnership is allegedly engineered and funded by Pakistan's ISI. The groups aim to target Baloch people. There is a possibility of expansion to Jammu and Kashmir. Visual evidence shows commanders training together. This alliance follows India's counterterror actions.

title: Tech regulation: Zoho founder Sridhar Vembu to Google, Apple; ‘Follow Indian law’
description: Zoho founder Sridhar Vembu outlined his company's three-tiered approach to user privacy on X. He detailed protections for "secret lover" data, a pledge against using customer data for advertising, and the limits of corporate responsibility in "secret rebel" cases, emphasizing adherence to national laws.

title: Dementia starts in your legs, top neurosurgeon warns
description: A leading neurosurgeon reveals a surprising link between leg strength and dementia prevention.  Weak leg muscles can accelerate cognitive decline, as active muscles release chemicals vital for brain health.  Maintaining strong legs through walking and strength training is crucial for protecting memory and preventing falls, offering a powerful strategy to safeguard your brain's well-being.

title: Amazon founder Jeff Bezos: I always advise to young people - 'Go work at ...'
description: Amazon founder Jeff Bezos advises young aspiring entrepreneurs to gain foundational experience by working at McDonald's. He emphasizes that such roles teach crucial skills like responsibility, discipline, and customer interaction, which are vital for long-term success and often overlooked by Gen Z in their pursuit of rapid startup growth.
